citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water (Data creator)
citeinfo.title: IMPAIRED_LAKES_IDEM_IN: Impaired Lakes in Indiana on the 303(d) List of 2006 (Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Polygon Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality

citeinfo.othercit:
This data set was provided to personnel of Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates (BLA) by Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water personnel.
The data set provided was in an ESRI shapefile format, and was named "in_303d2006_utm_lakes."

descript.abstract:
This 2006 303(d) list of impaired lakes represents the streams, and rivers, that are eligible for the development of Total Maximum Daily Load limits. There are fields for each parameter for which the water body may be impaired. These Boolean fields allow for easy legend queries on each parameter or sets of parameters. Twenty-four listed streams that are included in the data table (indicated by 0 values for Dur_id, T_meas, Rch_date) do not have topology so that they do not show in the line features and will not query from the view or with theme queries; only table queries.
All impaired streams represented by lines are contained in a separate shapefile called IMPAIRED_STREAMS_IDEM_IN. These shapefiles must be used together to view all waters listed on the 303d report.
descript.purpose: This data layer was developed to communicate the location and extent of the listed impaired water bodies as determined by the TMDL Committee and Technical Staff. The shapefile illustrates the impaired water bodies for display at public meetings, to include in reports and to use for comparison over time as the list is updated bi-annually.
descript.supplinf:
All impaired streams represented by lines are contained in a separate shapefile called IMPAIRED_STREAMS_IDEM_IN. These shapefiles must be used together to view all waters listed on the 303d report.
The level of editing done by BLA is fully disclosed in the process steps of this metadata; credit for the information is retained by the originator.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS version 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 488 Kb

attracc.attraccr: Unknown. No records exist at Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates regarding the attribute accuracy of this shapefile. For more information, contact Jody Arthur, 305(b)/303(d) Coordinator, Indiana Department of Environmental Management, (jarthur@dem.state.in.us), 317-234-1424.

dataqual.logic: This data set was provided by IDEM personnel and is assumed to be accurate.
dataqual.complete:
Unknown. No records exist at Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates regarding the completenes of this shapefile. For more information, contact Jody Arthur, 305(b)/303(d) Coordinator, Indiana Department of Environmental Management, (jarthur@dem.state.in.us), 317-234-1424.
This file must be used with its companion IMPAIRED_STREAMS_IDEM_IN shapefile to obtain a full assessment of impaired waters.

horizpa.horizpar: Unknown. No records exist at Bernardin, Lochmueller & Associates regarding the attribute accuracy of this shapefile. For more information, contact contact Jody Arthur, 305(b)/303(d) Coordinator, Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality (jarthur@dem.state.in.us), 317-234-1424.

citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality
citeinfo.title: IN_303d2006_UTM_Streams

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Environmental Managment, Office of Water Quality

citeinfo.othercit: 2004 303(d) list is available from IDEM's TMDL Web site.

srcinfo.srccontr: Listing of all impaired waters eligible for TMDL limits

citeinfo.origin: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality
citeinfo.title: 303d_epa2004_Lakes

pubinfo.publish: Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Quality

citeinfo.othercit: This file must be used in conjunction with its companion IMPAIRED_STREAMS_IDEM_IN shapefile to get a full count of all impaired waters.

procstep.procdesc: The ESRI ArcGIS shapefile named "In_303d2006_utm_lakes.shp" containing the 303(d) impaired lakes were delivered to BLA personel on March 15, 2007. The table field named "OID_," "State," "County," and "ATTR_VAL" were deleted. This file was then re-named "IMPAIRED_LAKES_IDEM_IN."

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

attr.attrdef: NHD Digital Update Unit (DUU) Identifier
attr.attrdefs: NHD, Reach Indexing Tool (from NHD Transport Reach theme)

attr.attrdef: Date record was created. Corresponds to the date that the assessment unit was originally indexed to the NHD.
The Reach Index Number in 2 parts to designate the 8-digit basin by initials and an unique identifier, plus a unique number for centerlines of lakes and reservoirs.
NHD linear reach code
Event ID - date, time sequence, and 4 character code
Metadata Indentification information, consisting of date, time sequence, and 4 character code.
The major hydrologic basin in which the reach is located. Basins do not correspond to the U.S. Geological Survey 6-digit HUC's. Rather, they correspond to IDEM's rotating monitoring schedule.
U.S. Geological Survey 14-digit hydrologic unit code (HUC).
Identifies the ADB assessment unit, or segment, associated with the NHD reach (RCH_CODE); Analogous to Enity_ID
Name of the ADB assessment unit, or segment (WBSEGID/ENTITY_ID).
Represents the size (in acres) of the ADB assessment unit, or segment, as a whole.
Defines unit of measurement for Segsize; A = "Acres"

Represents the total number of impairments for the ADB assessment unit (segment) to which the NHD reach is associated. Note that this value is redundant and appears once for each NHD reach included associated with a given "Wbsegid." Note that this value is redundant and appears once for each record associated with a given "Wbsegid" or "Entity ID." This value is not additive.
Fish Consumption Advisory for Mercury - more than one result in three-year period exceeds chronic aquatic criterion (CAC) defined in Indiana's water quality standards.
Fish Consumption Advisory (FCA) for polychlorinated biphenyls (PCB's)
Ecoli exceeds State limits
Impaired Biotic Community
Waterbody is impaired for low dissolved oxygen. Impairment applies to all records associated with a given "Wbsegid" or "Entity_ID."
Inorganic nutrients driving physio/chemical water imbalance.
Aquatic plant or algal growth that creates a nuisance, is unsightly, or otherwise impairs designated use.
Waterbody is impaired for taste and odor. Impairment applies to all records associated with a given "Wbsegid" or "Entity_ID."
Presence of Ammonia exceeds State limits.
pH is outside criteria range defined in Indiana's water quality standards.
Imbeddedness and smothering or substrate in streams, or loss of depth in lakes.
Total Dissolved Solids exceeds State limits
Sulfate anion concentration exceeds State water quality standards.
Chloride anion concentration exceeds State water quality standards.
More than one result in three-year period exceeds chronic aquatic criterion (CAC) for "copper" as defined in State water quality standards.
Free cyanide in waterbodies within the Great Lakes watersheds. Total cyanide in other Indiana waterbodies.
More than one result in three-year period exceeds chronic aquatic criterion (CAC) for "lead" as defined in State water quality standards.
More than one result in three-year period exceeds chronic aquatic criterion (CAC) for "nickel" as defined in State water quality standards.
More than one result in three-year period exceeds chronic aquatic criterion (CAC) for "Zinc" as defined in State water quality standards.
Dioxin concentration exceeds ORSANCO 2003 criterion for human health protection for the Ohio River.
Refers to chlordane, endrin, or DDT. More than one result in three-year period exceeds chronic aquatic criterion (CAC) defined in State water quality standards.
Legacy code no longer used to indicate impairment. PAH and Priority Organics are now used when data is available.
Cooresponds to the size of the NHD reach (RCH_CODE) indexed (in units of "square kilometers."

distinfo.distliab:
No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA/IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA/IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA/IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
